questions.text: _______ is the code with natural language mixed with Java code.

What is the exact output of the following code?

  double area = 3.5;
  System.out.print("area");
  System.out.print(area);

Suppose a Scanner object is created as follows, what method do you use to read a real number?

Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

The following code fragment reads in two numbers. What is the incorrect way to enter these two numbers?

Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
int i = input.nextInt();
double d = input.nextDouble();

choices.label: A
choices.text: Enter an integer, a space, a double value, and then the Enter key.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Enter an integer, two spaces, a double value, and then the Enter key.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Enter an integer, an Enter key, a double value, and then the Enter key.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Enter a numeric value with a decimal point, a space, an integer, and then the Enter key.

questions.text:
If you enter 1 2 3, when you run this program, what will be the output?

import java.util.Scanner;

public class Test1 {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.print("Enter three numbers: ");
    double number1 = input.nextDouble();
    double number2 = input.nextDouble();
    double number3 = input.nextDouble();

    // Compute average
    double average = (number1 + number2 + number3) / 3;

    // Display result
    System.out.println(average);
  }
}

Analyze the following code.

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int month = 09;
    System.out.println("month is " + month);
  }
}

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program has a syntax error, because 09 is an incorrect literal value.

The System.currentTimeMillis() returns ________________ .

choices.label: C
choices.text: the current time in milliseconds since midnight.

choices.label: D

choices.label: E

To obtain the current hour in UTC, use _________.
Suppose x is 1. What is x after x += 2?
Suppose x is 1. What is x after x -= 1?

What is x after the following statements?

int x = 2;
int y = 1;
x *= y + 1;

int x = 1;
x *= x + 1;

(A) x -= x + 4
(B) x = x + 4 - x
(C) x = x - (x + 4)

What is i printed?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int j = 0;
    int i = ++j + j * 5;

    System.out.println("What is i? " + i);
  }
}

What is i printed in the following code?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int j = 0;
    int i = j++ + j * 5;

    System.out.println("What is i? " + i);
  }
}

What is y displayed in the following code?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int x = 1;
    int y = x++ + x;
    System.out.println("y is " + y);
  }
}

What is y displayed?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int x = 1;
    int y = x + x++;
    System.out.println("y is " + y);
  }
}

Are the following four statements equivalent?

  number += 1;
  number = number + 1;
  number++;
  ++number;

_____________ is a formal process that seeks to understand the problem and document in detail what the software system needs to do.

_____________ seeks to analyze the data flow and to identify the system?s input and output. When you do analysis, it helps to identify what the output is first, and then figure out what input data you need in order to produce the output.

Suppose int x = 3264, what is the output of the following code?

  int y = x % 10;
  x = x / 10;
  System.out.println("x is " + x + " and y is " + y);

Analyze the following code:

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int n = 10000 * 10000 * 10000;
    System.out.println("n is " + n);
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: The result of 10000 * 10000 * 10000 is too large to be stored in an int variable n. This causes an overflow and the program is aborted.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The result of 10000 * 10000 * 10000 is too large to be stored in an int variable n. This causes an overflow and the program continues to execute because Java does not report errors on overflow.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The result of 10000 * 10000 * 10000 is too large to be stored in an int variable n. This causes an underflow and the program is aborted.

choices.label: E
choices.text: The result of 10000 * 10000 * 10000 is too large to be stored in an int variable n. This causes an underflow and the program continues to execute because Java does not report errors on underflow.

questions.text: When assigning a literal to a variable of the byte type, if the literal is too large to be stored as a byte value, it _____________.
